Title/Description: Global food production by category (weight + calories)
Notes: Global food production categorized by weight and caloric content. Aggregated from FAO and Poore & Nemecek.

Title/Description: Top global food commodities by production weight
Notes: Top food commodities ranked by global production weight. Based on FAOSTAT crop volumes.

Title/Description: Top global food commodities by caloric contribution
Notes: Top food commodities by caloric contribution. Derived from FAOSTAT Food Balance Sheets.

Title/Description: Regional patterns in major food commodity production
Notes: Regional specialization in food commodity production. E.g. maize in North America, rice in Asia.

Title/Description: Allocation of global crop calories to animal feed
Notes: Estimates of global crop calories diverted to animal feed. Drawn from Poore & Nemecek and FAO.

Title/Description: Plant vs. animal-based food production (weight and caloric contribution)
Notes: Figure comparing plant- vs. animal-based food production by weight and calorie share.

Title/Description: Regional food production volumes by continent
Notes: Regional comparison of food production volumes by continent. Based on P0.M1.DT04 data.

Title/Description: Structured synthesis of global food production patterns (weight, calories, categories, regions, feed)
Notes: Structured synthesis of global food production by category, region, and system type.

Title/Description: Global food losses and waste by stage, region, and commodity
Notes: Derived from FAO (2011, 2019) and UNEP (2021) datasets. Disaggregates food loss and waste by stage, region, and commodity.

Title/Description: Global food loss and waste by food group and supply chain stage
Notes: Loss and waste rates by food group and supply chain stage. Source: FAO (2011), UNEP (2021).

Title/Description: Global Food Loss and Waste Distribution by Supply Chain Stage
Notes: Bar chart visualizing estimated percentage loss by supply chain stage. Based on FAO and UNEP datasets.

Title/Description: Regional Food Loss and Waste Distribution by Supply Chain Stage
Notes: Illustrates regional variation in food loss and waste across supply chain stages. Based on FAO and UNEP data.

Title/Description: Evidence-based synthesis of food loss and waste distribution, causes, and disparities
Notes: Synthesis of global food loss and waste patterns. Draws on institutional data to highlight stage- and region-specific inefficiencies.

Title/Description: Global agricultural land allocation by use and commodity
Notes: Integrates land use data from FAOSTAT, EarthStat, and Poore & Nemecek (2018). Provides land allocation by food system.

Title/Description: Global water and nitrogen use in agriculture
Notes: Water and nitrogen input use across crops. Sources: AQUASTAT, FAOSTAT, Poore & Nemecek (2018).

Title/Description: Resource Allocation in Global Food Systems â€“ Plant vs. Animal-Based
Notes: Visual comparison of resource use between plant- and animal-based food systems.

Title/Description: Narrative synthesis of global land, water, and nitrogen use patterns
Notes: Narrative synthesis of global land, water, and nitrogen use. Draws on Phase 0 empirical inputs.

Title/Description: Global food trade flows by commodity and country
Notes: FAOSTAT trade data by commodity and country. Provides bilateral trade volume and value.

Title/Description: Agricultural subsidy structures by region
Notes: OECD and WTO agricultural subsidy reports. Disaggregates subsidy flows by type and region.

Title/Description: Visual of food trade interdependence network
Notes: Network diagram showing global interdependence in food trade flows. Based on bilateral trade data from FAOSTAT.

Title/Description: Structural and economic organization of the global food system
Notes: Summarizes trade architecture, subsidy regimes, and market concentration in the global food system.

Title/Description: Global religious and cultural dietary norms
Notes: Summarizes major religious and cultural dietary restrictions by region. Based on Pew, FAO, and WRI.

Title/Description: National food regimes and political economy of animal agriculture
Notes: Outlines national food regimes and the political economy of animal agriculture. Sources include IPES-Food and FAO.

Title/Description: Political and industry actors shaping animal agriculture policy
Notes: Documents corporate and political actors influencing livestock policy. Drawn from IPES-Food and FAO.

Title/Description: Annotated map of cultural-political dietary resistance domains
Notes: Annotated global map showing political-cultural dietary resistance. Data coded by region and dominant system.

Title/Description: Synthesis of cultural, religious, and political barriers to food system change
Notes: Synthesizes cultural and political constraints to food system change. Maps resistance to dietary shifts.

Title/Description: Harmonized global food system baseline dataset
Notes: Harmonized dataset compiling Phase 0 Modules 1â€“5. Includes production, loss, inputs, and sociopolitical constraints.

Title/Description: Global food system flow diagram (Sankey)
Notes: Sankey diagram showing flows from production through loss, feed, waste, and human consumption.

Title/Description: Structured synthesis of the global food system based on Modules 1â€“5
Notes: Structured synthesis of the global food system using harmonized data from all Phase 0 modules.

Title/Description: Historical synthesis of the food system from 1960 to present
Notes: Historical timeline of the global food system (1960â€“present), including Green Revolution and liberalization.

Title/Description: Globally harmonized nutrient intake targets across demographic groups
Notes: Includes energy, macronutrients, and micronutrient requirements across life stages. Data harmonized from FAO/WHO/UNU, EFSA, NIH, and GBD 2019 sources.

Title/Description: Global Nutrient Coverage Map (placeholder)
Notes: Placeholder for future comparative visualization. To be updated in subsequent modules.

Title/Description: Methodology and source alignment for global nutrient target harmonization
Notes: Documents the harmonization process, demographic structure, unit standardization, and source hierarchy.

Title/Description: Nutrient composition per 100g edible portion for top global commodities
Notes: Standardized nutrient profiles for sugarcane, maize, rice, wheat, and potatoes

Title/Description: Global nutrient availability by food type, category, and region
Notes: Computed using Phase 0 volumes and USDA/INFOODS nutrient densities

Title/Description: Global nutrient supply vs. population-weighted requirements
Notes: Log-scale visual comparison of supply vs. Phase 1 Module 1 needs

Title/Description: Methodology for estimating nutrient availability from global food production
Notes: Covers integration pipeline, conversions, assumptions, and boundaries

Title/Description: Bioavailability adjustment factors by nutrient and food source
Notes: Based on midpoint estimates from WHO/FAO consultations, EFSA opinions, NIH ODS profiles, and major nutrient bioavailability reviews. Values reflect plant-based, animal-based, and mixed-diet average absorption fractions.

Title/Description: Bioavailability-adjusted nutrient availability by food commodity
Notes: Adjusted from P1.M2.DT02 using mixed-diet absorption coefficients from WHO/FAO, EFSA, and peer-reviewed sources. Represents the estimated absorbable nutrient quantities available globally.

Title/Description: Gross vs. bioavailable nutrient supply (global total)
Notes: Compares gross nutrient supply (Module 2) to absorbable quantities based on bioavailability coefficients (Module 3). Uses log scale for visibility across orders of magnitude.

Title/Description: Methodology for bioavailability adjustment of nutrient supply
Notes: Documents sources, coefficients, and calculation process used to convert gross nutrient supply into absorbable equivalents. Based on mixed-diet estimates and authoritative institutional and scientific sources.

Title/Description: Demographic adequacy ratios for bioavailable nutrient supply
Notes: Compares per capita bioavailable supply (from M3) to per capita nutrient requirements (from M1) across 16 demographic groups. Ratios below 1 indicate shortfall risks.

Title/Description: Average global nutrient adequacy ratios by nutrient
Notes: Bar chart showing the average adequacy ratio for each nutrient across all demographic groups. Red line indicates the threshold of 1.0 (100% adequacy). Values below this line signal global shortfall risks.

Title/Description: Methodology for modeling demographic adequacy of nutrient intake
Notes: Details how daily per capita supply from Module 3 was compared to group-specific requirements from Module 1. Emphasizes assumptions and constraints related to uniformity and data aggregation.

Title/Description: Matrix of synergistic and inhibitory nutrient interactions in plant-based diets
Notes: Includes iron, zinc, calcium, magnesium, vitamin A and D interactions. Effect sizes synthesized from WHO/FAO reports, EFSA opinions, NIH summaries, and nutrient absorption literature.

Title/Description: Nutrient interaction network of synergies and inhibitors in plant-based systems
Notes: Visual network of known nutrient synergies (green edges) and inhibitors (red edges) based on WHO/FAO, EFSA, and scientific literature.

Title/Description: Methodology for identifying synergistic and inhibitory nutrient interactions
Notes: Summarizes sources and approach for mapping bioavailability-affecting nutrient interactions. Distinguishes between synergy and inhibition.

Title/Description: Risk classification of micronutrient adequacy by demographic group
Notes: Classifies adequacy risk by nutrient and demographic group using thresholds (<0.6: high risk, <0.9: moderate, <1.0: marginal, â‰¥1.0: adequate).

Title/Description: Heatmap of micronutrient risk levels across demographic groups
Notes: Visualizes the risk classification for each key micronutrient and demographic group using color-coded heat levels. Based on adequacy thresholds established in Module 6.

Title/Description: Risk classification criteria for population-level micronutrient adequacy
Notes: Defines adequacy risk thresholds by nutrient based on international guidelines. Explains classification logic and assumptions applied across age and sex groups.

Title/Description: Boundary case scenarios testing nutritional limits of plant-based diets
Notes: Defines six dietary edge cases with demographic, dietary, and biochemical risk assumptions. Identifies expected limiting nutrients and projected failure risks based on Modules 4â€“6.

Title/Description: Nutritional risk escalation by boundary case scenario
Notes: Color-coded visualization of expected nutritional vulnerability for six plant-based boundary scenarios. Draws on adequacy, risk, and interaction modules to highlight structural limitations.

Title/Description: Methodological framework for testing plant-based dietary boundary scenarios
Notes: Defines how edge-case diets and at-risk populations were selected and modeled. Clarifies limitations and modeling scope. Supports risk-focused synthesis in Phase 8.

Title/Description: Crop allocation by nutrient density
Notes: Compiled nutrient-per-hectare data from FAO and peer-reviewed agronomic literature to prioritize land-efficient crops for protein, iron, and calcium delivery.

Title/Description: Bar chart: Protein yield per hectare
Notes: Visualizes protein yield per hectare for key crops based on synthesized agronomic productivity data. Supports crop selection modeling.

Title/Description: Synthesis summary of crop allocation strategies
Notes: Analytical synthesis integrating nutrient density and land-use efficiency to inform crop prioritization for global plant-based food systems.

Title/Description: Crop yield by climate zone
Notes: Estimates of climate-specific crop yields modeled from FAO GAEZ zones, adjusted for regional productivity data. Used in spatial feasibility modeling.

Title/Description: Summary of crop-climate yield feasibility
Notes: Summarizes comparative yield potential across climate zones. Highlights geographic yield constraints and informs adaptive crop placement.

Title/Description: Water, GHG, and land trade-offs by crop
Notes: Compiled water, GHG, and land-use intensity values per crop from Poore & Nemecek (2018) and FAO environmental datasets for trade-off modeling.

Title/Description: Summary of crop-level environmental trade-offs
Notes: Narrative synthesis on sustainability trade-offs across key crops. Frames the role of cereals and legumes in balancing ecological impacts.

Title/Description: Regional cropland and yield potential
Notes: Regional cropland area and average yield values sourced from FAOSTAT and agroecological studies. Supports equity and feasibility modeling.

Title/Description: Summary of regional variation in plant-based yield potential
Notes: Summarizes regional production disparities and their implications for closing global yield gaps under a plant-based scenario.

Title/Description: Systemic risks and constraints
Notes: Catalog of systemic risks and agronomic stressors (climate, soil, pests) informed by IPCC and FAO resilience frameworks.

Title/Description: Summary of system constraints and resilience limits
Notes: Narrative synthesis of system failure points and adaptive strategies required to maintain productivity in plant-based food systems.

Title/Description: Comparative environmental impacts of plant-based vs conventional diets
Notes: Sources include Poore & Nemecek (2018), Clark et al. (2019), IPCC reports

Title/Description: Carbon and biodiversity benefits of land rewilding
Notes: Visual summary based on land-use projections and rewilding scenarios

Title/Description: Land sparing and carbon sequestration potential
Notes: Sources include IAM models, Hayek et al. (2021)

Title/Description: Risks and trade-offs of scaling plant-based food systems
Notes: Includes synthesis of risks from Springmann et al. and Searchinger et al.
